name: Shuckers' Portuguese Mussels
headline: Shuckers' Portuguese Mussels

image.description: WS of the Portugese Mussels from Shucker's in Cape Cod, MA as seen on Food Network's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives episode 2309.
WS of the Portugese Mussels from Shucker's in Cape Cod, MA as seen on Food Network's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives episode 2309.
WS of the Portugese Mussels from Shucker's in Cape Cod, MA as seen on Food Network's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives episode 2309.

keywords: European Recipes,Portuguese Recipes,Mussel,Shellfish Recipes,Bell Peppers,Vegetable,Chorizo,Sausage Recipes,Appetizer
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons butter, plus more for spreading

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together enough butter and garlic to spread on the bread. Split the bread down the middle and spread the garlic and butter mixture liberally on the bread. Bake until toasted, 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, clean and de-beard the mussels, and then set aside.

Set a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat, add 2 tablespoons of the butter to melt. Add the chourico and sweat for about 1 minute. Add the onions, green peppers and red peppers, and saute for 1 minute. Add the wine and 1/2 cup water, and stir. Add the mussels and cover; cook until the mussels open, 4 minutes.
Remove the saucepan from the heat. Transfer the mussels to a large bowl, then spoon the cooking liquid with the onions, peppers and chourico over the top.
Serve the bowl of mussels with the warm garlic bread.

review.reviewBody: I think the peppers and onions needed to cook down more before adding the mussels to impart more flavor. I also added garlic to the mussels. I think it definitely needed red pepper flakes or something to give it a kick. Not bad, but not exceptional. With chorizo, I expected a bigger flavor punch
Pretty good dish.  Broth was pleasant but somewhat lackluster. I added some butter and red pepper flakes to give it a bit more heat and a fuller flavor.
